extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 pounds peeled and deveined large shrimp

title: Chili-Lime Shrimp
summary: Chili-Lime Shrimp is a gluten free, primal, and pescatarian recipe with 4 servings. For $3.67 per serving, this recipe covers 19% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 230 calories, 35g of protein, and 8g of fat. It works best as a main course, and is done in approximately 10 minutes. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. Head to the store and pick up salt, lime juice, green onions, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the lime juice you could follow this main course with the Lime Angel Food Cake with Lime Glaze and Pistachios as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 50%. This score is good. Similar recipes include Chili Lime Shrimp Bowls, Chili-Lime Shrimp Kabobs, and Chili Lime Shrimp Bowls.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.

instructions: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add 1/2 cup onions; coat onions with cooking spray. Cook 1 minute, stirring occasionally. Add shrimp and chili powder; cook 4 minutes or until desired degree of doneness, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Add lime juice, butter, and salt, and stir until butter melts. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup onions.

steps.step: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray.
Add 1/2 cup onions; coat onions with cooking spray. Cook 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
Add shrimp and chili powder; cook 4 minutes or until desired degree of doneness, stirring occasionally.
Add lime juice, butter, and salt, and stir until butter melts.
